x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
During disaster events such as floods, fire outbreaks, or disease outbreaks, response teams often struggle to manage multiple urgent activities at once.
-Manual task allocation is slow and inefficient -Responders lack visibility into priority incidents -Valuable time is lost deciding who should handle what
This delay can lead to slower emergency responses and increased damage or loss of life
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Flow Designer: Automated task creation and routing to responders
  • UI Policy: Dynamic form experience for response teams
  • Notifications: Real-time task assignments and escalations
  • Reporting & Dashboards: Visibility into incident response status
  • AI Search: Fast access to procedures, knowledge, or similar incidents
  • Predictive Intelligence: Auto-classify incidents and suggest assignment groups
  • Performance Analytics: Track response time, completion rates, and escalation trends

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Predictive Intelligence plugin for AI-driven classification and suggestions
  • Optional Integration Hub for sending external emergency alerts
  • Flow Designer for routing disaster tasks and Notifications

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring proper model training for accurate AI predictions
  • Managing prioritization when multiple critical incidents occur simultaneously
  • Maintaining secure access control for sensitive emergency data
  • Encouraging adoption and trust in AI-driven recommendations
  • Handling performance analytics setup and configuration for response trends
